alteration in plan; for those portions of the columnar segments
which lie between the two annular canals of each zone, and
the two surfaces of the disk,become completely differentiated
from the portions that occupy the intermediate stratum,
so as to form a peculiar set of <u>superficial cells</u>; and these
are so equally connected with <u>two</u> zones, as to make it
impossible to say that they belong specifically to either.

66  Now we have seen that <u>development</u> may be checked,
while <u>growth</u> continues, at any period of its progress; so that
we find Orbitolites growing to a considerable size upon the
very simple plan, - others still larger formed upon the
duplex plan, - the largest yet known (fossilized in the
Paris Basin) developed upon the <u>multiple</u> plan without
separation of the superficial cells,_ while the most complete,
in regard alike to multiplication and to differentiation of
parts, are only found among the disks at present existing;-
and it is interesting to observe, that some of these,[<sup>2</sup> while as
yet of comparatively minute size<sup>2</sup>][<sup>1</sup> present the highest grade of development]<sup>1</sup>. I am not acquainted with any other
